block.p: Marcella Elizabeth Anderlini, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Philip R. Anderlini of Kentfield, Calif., was married yesterday to John Christopher Churchill, a son of Mary C. Churchill of New York and John P. Churchill of Hampton, N.J. P. Terry Anderlini, a cousin of the bride who was appointed a state civil marriage celebrant for the day, officiated at the Palace Hotel in San Francisco.

Mrs. Churchill, 35, is the director of software product management for Quiver Inc., a San Francisco company that develops Internet search and directory services for businesses. She graduated from the University of California at San Diego and received an M.B.A. from the University of Southern California. Her father retired as the managing partner of Mullen & Filippi, a San Francisco law firm.

Marcella Elizabeth Anderlini, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Philip R. Anderlini of Kentfield, Calif., was married yesterday to John Christopher Churchill, a son of Mary C. Churchill of New York and John P. Churchill of Hampton, N.J. P. Terry Anderlini, a cousin of the bride who was appointed a state civil marriage celebrant for the day, officiated at the Palace Hotel in San Francisco.

Mrs. Churchill, 35, is the director of software product management for Quiver Inc., a San Francisco company that develops Internet search and directory services for businesses. She graduated from the University of California at San Diego and received an M.B.A. from the University of Southern California. Her father retired as the managing partner of Mullen & Filippi, a San Francisco law firm.

Mr. Churchill, 36, is known as Chris. He is the director of technology sales for Ask Jeeves, the online information and communications company, in Emoryville, Calif. He graduated from the University of New Hampshire.

The bridegroom's mother is the president of M. Churchill Communications, a public relations firm in New York. His father owns a manufacturers' representative business in the electronics field in Hampton.
